channel.title: Funny Prank V1.2 [RELEASE]
channel.description:

THIS IS THE DOWNGRADED VERSION! CAUSE MANY PEOPLE IS SAYING V1 WAS A VIRUS! THIS IS V1.2 -------------------- USE AT YOUR OWN RISK -------------------- Introduction: This package with overflow jokes was brought to you buy lots of people for credits. [/code]

item.title: Funny Prank V1.2 [RELEASE]
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Davidi2:

What on earth are you guys talking about…

Wow biggest leech of utube. i was using these like 1 yr and a half ago. want a real good Fake virus ill tell you how to make one.

Go to your desktop.right click then make a new Shortcut
it will ask you where you want the shortcut to lead to. copy and paste this in their
shutdown -s -t10 -c"bye bye"
so its either the first one or this one thats right
shutdown -s -t 10 -c"bye bye"
then rename the shortcut.
change the icon and send it to people when the open it a box will come up with a timer and turn off their computer once the timer hits 0.

(im not sure if i did it right)

Look on the first page for it

Read full topic

item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

as this forum suffers from a java infestation one has no real need to post an executable file of any shape or form, that’s why it flags as suspicious to this forum’s members however i was not talking about the average member of this forum, i was talking about an average joe who uses a computer for little more than email, im and surfing the net.

Read full topic

item.title: Funny Prank V1.2 [RELEASE]
item.dc:creator: @whip_of_soulz whip of soulz
item.description:
@whip_of_soulz wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:15, topic:375656”][quote author=_s link=topic=471589.msg3466349#msg3466349 date=1294939570]

You can use Java to shut down someones computer as well, and then you wouldn’t have to use shitty VB.

you can also use java (with some inevitable assembly) to write an OS (see: http://www.jnode.org/), and then you wouldn’t have to use a language more suited to the purpose! not defending visual basic, just saying that i think i’d put more money on average joe running a native executable written in visual basic than a jar file containing java bytecode classes when the goal is obviously to get people to run it. every language has something that is a plus, in this case visual basic-written applications have the benefit of compilation to a more familiar filetype to average joe. when most people run a .jar first time without knowing what it is they are rightfully sceptical. a nice, happy looking PE file with a bright logo looks at lot less conspicuous but has the capability to do a lot more damage if required.
[/quote]Very true. But on this forum, releasing anything as .exe throws up an instant red flag.[/quote]
Only some retarded kid would try and infect somebody here with their virus as an .exe.

Read full topic

you can also use java (with some inevitable assembly) to write an OS (see: http://www.jnode.org/), and then you wouldn’t have to use a language more suited to the purpose! not defending visual basic, just saying that i think i’d put more money on average joe running a native executable written in visual basic than a jar file containing java bytecode classes when the goal is obviously to get people to run it. every language has something that is a plus, in this case visual basic-written applications have the benefit of compilation to a more familiar filetype to average joe. when most people run a .jar first time without knowing what it is they are rightfully sceptical. a nice, happy looking PE file with a bright logo looks at lot less conspicuous but has the capability to do a lot more damage if required.[/quote]Very true. But on this forum, releasing anything as .exe throws up an instant red flag.
